alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 5:54PM MST until August 10 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 554 PM MST, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Copeland Ave. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Timberline, Fernwood and Hutchison Acres. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 425 and 428. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flash flooding is occurring or imminent downstream of the Pipeline Fire scar, including Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Hutchinson Acres, Macann Estates and Doney Park. Ash and debris-filled waters will impact roads, including Highway 89. Shelter in place until the waters recede. Stay out of flood waters!
